comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From April 27, 1912 NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9805E2DE153CE633A... : PASSENGERS PRAISE NEW FRENCH LINER; The France Found to be a Good Sea Boat and Her Turbines Give Little Vibration. The new French liner France, arrived in port yesterday afternoon on her maiden voyage from Havre, with 324 cabin and 949 steerage passengers. Capt. Poncelet took the new long southern course, and did not sight any ice on the voyage.
